Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan and the Circus
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan in a circus setting and follows his encounter with Matto Grasso, ultimately leading to Paul briefly joining the circus and then departing.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Introduction and Visitor's Curiosity
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces the circus setting and various characters' initial encounters with it, from Paul Bunyan's act to townspeople reacting to the circus's arrival.

narrative_arcs.title: Man Hears News of the Circus
Family Reacts to Giraffe at Circus

sub_scenes.title: Tent Trouble and Paul Bunyan's Intervention
sub_scenes.description: This scene focuses on the man in the checkered shirt investigating a disturbance in a tent, leading to a fight and the revelation that he is Paul Bunyan.

narrative_arcs.title: Pistol Threat and Revelation of Identity

sub_scenes.title: The Circus Owner's Offer
sub_scenes.description: Following the fight, the circus owner expresses gratitude and offers Paul Bunyan a job as the circus strongman.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Revelation of Past Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Matto Grasso's Revenge and Foiled Arson
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Paul Bunyan's debut as a strongman, Matto Grasso's envious reaction, and his attempt to set the circus tent on fire, which is quickly thwarted by Paul.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Debut and Matto Grasso's Envy
Circus Tent Fire and Paul Bunyan's Swift Action

sub_scenes.title: Ape Release and The Chase
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso, frustrated by his failed arson, plots a new scheme involving releasing an ape, but Paul Bunyan again intervenes, leading to a chase.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Frustration and a New Scheme
The Ape's Release and Paul's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Arena Chase and Failed Attempts
sub_scenes.description: The chase of the ape releaser moves into the circus arena, where the releaser makes comical attempts to evade capture.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Arena and a New Plan
The Hat Trick and Continued Escape

sub_scenes.title: Unscheduled Fight and Trapeze Threat
sub_scenes.description: A spontaneous fight breaks out in the arena, observed by onlookers, culminating in a dramatic trapeze toss threat.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Paul's Departure
sub_scenes.description: The fight concludes with a trapeze toss, leading to Paul being offered the strongman position, which he ultimately declines, choosing to return to the North Woods.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Adventures
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo in a series of encounters, starting with the Ogress of Tibet and leading him to Hi-Toun and a new quest.

sub_scenes.title: Marco Polo's Encounter in Tibet
sub_scenes.description: This scene briefly introduces Marco Polo's past adventurous exploits, specifically mentioning a confrontation with the 'Awful Ogress of Tibet'.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet

sub_scenes.title: The Mystery of the Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: A new storyline begins with a man on horseback discovering a talking severed head in a forest.

sub_scenes.title: Guidance and Arrival at Mourning City
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo helps an old man and receives guidance towards Hi-Toun, where he finds the city in mourning.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Guidance from the Old Man

sub_scenes.title: The King's Plea and a New Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo is welcomed by the King of Hi-Toun, who explains his grief over his missing daughter, leading Marco Polo to encounter a woman in distress.

narrative_arcs.title: The King's Grief Over Daughter Lotus's Disappearance
Encounter with a Starving Woman and the Witch's Castle

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Ogress of Tibet
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Marco Polo's entrapment by and confrontation with the Ogress of Tibet in her castle.

sub_scenes.title: The Witch's Castle and the Ogress's Trap
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo enters the mysterious castle with the old woman, only to discover her true nature as the Ogress of Tibet and fall into her trap.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Imprisonment as a 'Guest' and Ogress Revelation
Confrontation with Tusked Mice and Ogress's Claws

sub_scenes.title: The Cloaked Figure's Attack
sub_scenes.description: This scene shifts to a different narrative involving a cloaked figure attacking a man with fire and then using snakes to entrap him.

sub_scenes.title: Escape from the Ogress
sub_scenes.description: A new storyline begins with captives of an old woman who are threatened with being eaten, but they manage to escape using a hidden magic knife.

narrative_arcs.title: The Unexpected Attack and Its Success

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: The escaped captives journey to the woman's father, experiencing a cultural misunderstanding upon arrival and a joyful reunion.

narrative_arcs.title: Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of betrayal and revenge centered around a buried treasure in Agra, India.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Keeper's Prologue
sub_scenes.description: A Treasure Keeper introduces the story of treasure with a scroll, setting a dark and ominous tone.

sub_scenes.title: Penal Colony Setting
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to a British penal colony, establishing the setting and introducing characters involved in daily routines and secret requests.

narrative_arcs.title: Penal Colony Routine and Officer's Request

sub_scenes.title: The Treasure Deal
sub_scenes.description: A prisoner makes a desperate plea to Captain Brooking, offering him a share of a buried treasure in exchange for help escaping.

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Vengeance
sub_scenes.description: Joseph Jordan discovers Captain Brooking has betrayed him, leading to a vow of revenge that spans years.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
Years Later - Freedom and Undying Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Deception
sub_scenes.description: Years later, Joseph Jordan confronts Captain Brooking, who feigns ignorance but invites Jordan to his home under false pretenses.

sub_scenes.title: Attic Betrayal and Murder
sub_scenes.description: Inside Brooking's house, the deception turns deadly as Brooking reveals his plan to murder Jordan and keep the treasure for himself.

sub_scenes.title: Police Investigation of Murder
sub_scenes.description: The sound of a gunshot alerts the police, who investigate Brooking's house and discover the crime scene, leading to the suspect's escape.

sub_scenes.title: Moral of the Treasure Tale
sub_scenes.description: An old man storyteller provides a moral conclusion to the treasure story, warning about the evils of money.

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dr. Styx and his involvement in investigating a haunted estate, culminating in a confrontation with a vengeful ghost and a path to salvation.

sub_scenes.title: Dr. Styx's Menace
sub_scenes.description: This scene briefly introduces Dr. Styx in a threatening posture, setting a tone for his character.

sub_scenes.title: Courtroom Drama
sub_scenes.description: A courtroom scene depicts the sentencing of Vincent Matthews for murder and the angry reaction of an observer.

sub_scenes.title: The Haunted Estate Beckons
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup and Dr. Styx discuss the haunted Matthews estate, leading to Mr. Northrup's arrival at the estate and a warning from Alvin.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Matthews' Estate and Haunting

sub_scenes.title: Entering the Haunted House
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup ignores Alvin's warning and enters the haunted Matthews Place, immediately encountering Vincent Matthews' ghost.

narrative_arcs.title: Ignoring Alvin's Warning and Entering the House

sub_scenes.title: Fight with the Ghost
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup engages in a physical confrontation with Vincent Matthews' ghost, initially being captured but ultimately overpowering the ghost.

sub_scenes.title: Salvation through Forgiveness
sub_scenes.description: Following the fight, a dialogue ensues where the ghost reveals that salvation for Mr. Northrup lies in forgiveness from his murdered sister, Rosalind.

narrative_arcs.title: Seeking Guidance and Receiving Advice on Salvation
Revelation of Rosalind as the Key to Salvation

sub_scenes.title: Forced Confrontation and Summons
sub_scenes.description: A figure in red and black forces the white figure to confront Rosalind's spirit, leading to her summoning.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Confrontation and Accusation of Cowardice
Physical Restraint and Assertion of Superior Strength

sub_scenes.title: Rosalind's Judgment and Forgiveness
sub_scenes.description: Rosalind appears and is directed to judge the white figure, ultimately offering forgiveness for his actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation and Identification of the Destroyer
Request for a Favor: Permitting Rest

sub_scenes.title: Brotherly Love and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: A deeper form of resolution is sought through brotherly love, leading to the white figure's release and the spirits finding peace.

narrative_arcs.title: Acceptance of Brotherly Love and Release

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Farewell of Spirits
sub_scenes.description: The spirits of Vincent and Rosalind achieve peace and depart, with the figure in red and black returning to a more mundane reality.

narrative_arcs.title: Vincent's Remorse and Rosalind's Ultimate Forgiveness

Major_Arcs.title: The Voyages of Henry Hudson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc recounts the voyages of Henry Hudson, his quest for the Northwest Passage, and the tragic mutiny that led to his demise.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Henry Hudson
sub_scenes.description: An introduction to Henry Hudson's historical context and his mysterious fate after being set adrift.

narrative_arcs.title: The Mysterious Fate of Henry Hudson

sub_scenes.title: The Dutch Proposal
sub_scenes.description: The Dutch East India Company proposes to Captain Hudson that he search for the Northwest Passage.

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage and Disappointment
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's first voyage faces crew discontent and ultimately leads to the discovery of the Hudson River, which proves not to be the Northwest Passage, resulting in a return to Holland.

narrative_arcs.title: Growing Discontent and Demand to Turn South
Entering the Hudson River and False Hope
Hudson's Resignation and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage and Icy Winter
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's second expedition takes a northerly route and gets trapped in ice, forcing them to overwinter and leading to further crew discontent.

narrative_arcs.title: Hudson's Second Expedition and Icy Route
Resumption of Voyage and Crew's Grievances

sub_scenes.title: Mutiny and Abandonment
sub_scenes.description: Crew discontent culminates in a mutiny, where Captain Hudson and loyal officers are set adrift, leading to Hudson's tragic end.

Major_Arcs.title: The Arabian Knight and the Tartar Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the Arabian Knight, Hassan, on a mission to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen, leading to a trial by combat and a romantic farewell.

sub_scenes.title: The Arabian Knight and the Tartar Threat
sub_scenes.description: The scene introduces the Arabian Knight in pursuit of Tartar horsemen and then shifts to his briefing by the Caliph for a rescue mission.

narrative_arcs.title: Summoned by Caliph and Mission Briefing

sub_scenes.title: Journey and Traveler's Warning
sub_scenes.description: Hassan sets off on his mission, encountering a deserted oasis and a traveler who warns him of the dangers ahead, but ultimately blesses his rescue attempt.

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration of Tartar Camp
sub_scenes.description: Hassan infiltrates the Tartar camp by subduing a sentry and using his cloak as a disguise, then overhears information about the captive woman.

sub_scenes.title: Discovery and Capture
sub_scenes.description: Hassan makes contact with the captive woman but is quickly discovered and captured by Tartar guards.

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat Agreement
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is brought before Kurgan and agrees to a trial by combat to determine the fate of the captive woman and peace for his land.

sub_scenes.title: Beginning of Combat
sub_scenes.description: The trial by combat commences, with Hassan signaling the start and revealing his unconventional strategy.

sub_scenes.title: Hassan's Victory and Kurgan's Honor
sub_scenes.description: Hassan fights bravely and defeats the Tartar fighters, leading to Kurgan honoring his word and granting Hassan safe passage.

narrative_arcs.title: Kurgan's Recognition and Grant of Safe Passage

sub_scenes.title: Farewell and Affection
sub_scenes.description: In the aftermath of the combat, Kurgan praises Hassan, and Hassan shares a moment of budding romance with the rescued woman before parting ways near Bagdad.
